dmca.title: Unauthorized use of and copying of American Racing Equipment marks and trade dress-no
dmca.body:
________________________________

From: MAVERSANO [mailto:maversano@linerlaw.com] 
Posted At: Tuesday, October 24, 2006 5:57 PM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: Unauthorized use of and copying of American Racing
Equipment marks and trade dress-not hosted with Kore Domains
Subject: FW: Unauthorized use of and copying of American Racing
Equipment marks and trade dress-not hosted with Kore Domains


Dear Sir/Madam: We wrote to Wild West Domains ("WWD"), the registrar for
<coyswheels.com> about trademark infringement at this cite. They
indicated (see email below) that your company, ThePlanet.com is the
hosting company and, therefore is responsible for the content of the
website. Accordingly, attached is a copy of the letter sent to WWD which
outlines the infringement.
 
We look forward to receiving confirmation that the website will be
suspended or terminated pursuant to The Planet's Intellectual Property
Infringement Policy.
 
Sincerely, 
Mary B. Aversano
Senior Counsel
Liner Yankelevitz Sunshine & Regenstreif LLP
1100 Glendon Avenue, 14th Floor
Los Angeles, CA  90024-3503
Dir: 310.500.3565
Fax: 310.500.3501
Email: maversano@linerlaw.com
www.linerlaw.com


 

________________________________

From: trademarkclaims@wildwestdomains.com
[mailto:trademarkclaims@wildwestdomains.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, October 24, 2006 3:31 PM
To: MAVERSANO
Subject: RE: Unauthorized use of and copying of American Racing
Equipment marks and trade dress-not hosted with Kore Domains



Dear ,

Although the domain name COYSWHEEL.COM is registered through our
company, the website itself is hosted elsewhere. Any issues regarding
the content of the website will need to be addressed either to the owner
of the site directly, or to the hosting provider.  

Generally speaking, the operators of the DNS name servers and the
hosting providers are the same.  The DNS information can be found on the
Whois database.

hints on searching ARIN's WHOIS database

We can only process claims of trademark infringement against the content
of websites that we host.  ICANN, the managing body of internet domain
name registrars, specifically prohibits domain registrars from becoming
involved in disputes over domain ownership in their Uniform Domain
Dispute Resolution Policy. You may view the UDRP at: 

http://www.securepaynet.net/gdshop/legal_agreements/show_doc.asp?se=%2B&
prog%5Fid=cheapdomainregistration&pageid=UNIFORM%5FDOMAIN
<http://www.securepaynet.net/gdshop/legal_agreements/show_doc.asp?se=%2B
&prog%5Fid=cheapdomainregistration&pageid=UNIFORM%5FDOMAIN> 

Any disputes over the ownership or wording of the domain name itself
will need to be sent either to the owner, or through an arbitration
forum such as WIPO (http://www.wipo.int), or the local court system. 

Please feel free to contact us if we can provide further assistance.

Regards,

Domain Services

Kore Domains
